It's All Aboard for National Train Day. Thanks to the @NatlParkService, families can explore America's first intercontinental railroad from the comfort of your own home. Click the link for more information. 
https://t.co/pNf9c1YJu2
Wallace State President Dr. Vicki Karolewics awards diploma via FaceTime during drive-thru graduation celebration https://t.co/UlUtYDHVio via @CullmanTribune

Looks like Democratic leadership is at it again, creating some big government spending bill behind closed doors. This type of political game is not what the country needs right now. https://t.co/vo1BUlMOh2

While the national media narrative seems to constantly highlight that the United States has the most COVID-19 cases, it’s even more important to put things in perspective.  We have conducted the most testing and our per capita death rate is lower than many other countries. https://t.co/RvSErlimWY
Thank you @AlabamaNG for the flyover in Birmingham.  Your gesture and your service is greatly appreciated. https://t.co/NeIR0qMS3H

Today is #TeacherAppreciationDay and here in Alabama we have a whole lot of truly wonderful teachers. Your selfless and tireless work to educate kids in our state is incredible. Let’s all make sure to #SendTeachersLove today. Thank you, Teachers! https://t.co/EAEOlVc85h
An asteroid only 66 feet wide exploded in the air over Chelyabinsk, Russia in 2013, causing 1500 injuries. https://t.co/EDDZ0gWbug

Last week @SpeakerPelosi was on CNBC to call for expanding broadband into rural America. I was fighting for rural broadband when fighting for rural broadband wasn’t cool.  But I welcome all the support I can get for these efforts.  Let’s get rural broadband done! #ruralbroadband https://t.co/49fOdtzipu

Important news from the IRS: for VA & SSI recipients with eligible children, tomorrow is the deadline to act and quickly receive your full Economic Impact Payment. Please click the link for more information.  https://t.co/Xmf9gP1g5B

Rural broadband has been an issue for years, and I have been working on it for a long time. But it looks like some Dems just realized that. It’s time for bipartisan legislation that benefits rural Americans. Let’s get broadband done. https://t.co/QpMrOJefWS
Very sorry to hear this news. https://t.co/Y0qNSafj7d

Rural broadband has always been an essential need, and the COVID-19 crisis has put a spotlight on that. We must address this issue in the Phase 4 stimulus, and that’s why I sent a letter to House and Senate leadership today, urging them to take action and fund rural broadband. https://t.co/PC2I03eYrw

NASA’s Mars Helicopter now has a name: Ingenuity. This came from Northport’s very own Vaneeza Rupani, who was selected from a crowd of 28,000 to name the historic aircraft. We are very proud of her wonderful accomplishment. Congratulations, Vaneeza! https://t.co/b8Jfjui2sw
I appreciate the Federal Reserve of Atlanta highlighting my efforts to expand broadband to rural America  https://t.co/wldQnNZLqy via @AtlantaFed

The new Safer at Home order is a solid step in the right direction for Alabama. I am happy that @GovernorKayIvey loosened some restrictions on recreation, business, and health care services. I am hopeful that this new order will bring positive results for our state. https://t.co/VHFH0qekzL
Albertville custodian named Cintas Custodian of the Year https://t.co/SaF2gN50ee
We will never forget that day nine-years-ago. 2011 Tornado Anniversary Memorial https://t.co/LHX3V8jp9N via @YouTube

Launched in 1990 from the Space Shuttle Discovery, the Hubble Telescope has gone further than anything in history, inspiring us all along the way. Today marks 30 years that @NASAHubble has been on its mission, and we certainly hope that continues for 30 more. https://t.co/jMNEDQ3yzQ

Great news for Alabama! Funding from @HUDgov is headed our way. This allocation will make a positive and sizable impact for our communities that are struggling because of COVID-19. Thank you @SecretaryCarson https://t.co/uYvkIomKsn

For 220 years the Library of Congress has educated and inspired people around the world. As a co-chair of the LOC Caucus, I’d like to wish the @librarycongress a very happy birthday! https://t.co/fL5NOeQ1tK

One week from today, we will announce the winners of the 2020 4th District Art Competition. The 50 high school students who entered worked very hard, so even though we will announce the winners online, we will still try to make it special for them. https://t.co/gXabUuqqra

The NFL Draft starts later today, and I have a feeling our Alabama and Auburn guys are in for a big night!

Good luck to all of the @AlabamaFTBL & @AuburnFootball players in this years draft!

The Alabama Farmers Federation has created a website where National Guard members and Veterans who have been laid off from their jobs can look for work on Alabama's many farms. @AlfaFarmers   https://t.co/pcJs26fDe5
On the @jeff_poor show while Mary Elliott does school work. https://t.co/TcpZWDhP48

Interesting numbers from Huntsville Hospital CEO David Spillers. Huntsville Hospital currently has one patient on a ventilator because of COVID-19.   They have 55 patients on ventilators for other conditions not related to COVID-19.

The Chinese Communist Party has been working for years to become a global pharmacy. And after blatantly lying and withholding information about COVID-19, I think it’s time we implement Buy America policies in the medical supply and pharmaceutical industry. https://t.co/aSCrA7SrZ7

Conducting an online meeting this morning of the 4th District’s Get Back to Work committee that @GovernorKayIvey requested we all put together.  It’s time to be making these plans to get everyone back to work as soon as safely possible. https://t.co/j3VSyigerd

Enough is enough, we need to put political games aside. The PPP fund is depleted and Americans are counting on us to do something. I'm urging Democratic Leadership to support and pass the Senate replenishment bill. Now. 

https://t.co/odmvHSskQQ

1790 Census: counted by 650 US Marshals on horseback, recorded on forms made of parchment and animal skin.

2020 Census: can be counted on your phone while you watch a rerun of Bama’s 26-23 Championship win over UGA.

While you watch that OT thriller, fill out your Census! https://t.co/43TNsR8vvN

So far 19,244 PPP loans have been approved in Alabama.  For a total dollar amount of $3,819,600,518.  This program has had some issues, but they are getting worked out and it's having a big impact on Alabama.  We need to approve more money for this fund ASAP!
Three months ago today. https://t.co/uyNrEmkZiy
Photos from DeKalb County this morning.  A road that's been washed away on County Road 44 near Fyffe and flooding in Fort Payne that's the worst since May of 2003. https://t.co/mBpYORJO0s
Praying no one in Boaz was hurt. https://t.co/NLrJBggrug

Today we celebrate the 50th Anniversary of the Apollo 13 launch. The “successful failure” started with hope, brought near tragedy, and ended with triumph over incredible odds. 50 years later, our sights are still set on the Moon, but they now extend further, to Mars. https://t.co/G9kubbBpg4
Thanks to all the utility workers out there still on the job making sure the lights stay on, the water keeps flowing and the toilets keep flushing!  https://t.co/F22uZO5qOx via @YouTube
An article that echos the letter I sent to the President.  We need to be making more of our critical goods right here in America. https://t.co/FzMCiR3Zpb

https://t.co/d844k0PZz2

Two weeks ago I wrote about the critical need for rural broadband funding. Now, we have it:

✅ $200 million for FCC’s Connected Care Pilot Program
✅ $100 million to the ReConnect Program
✅$25 million for Distance Learning & Telemedicine 
✅$15 million for Rural Telehealth
Praying for and wishing the best for @BorisJohnson

Happy Census Day!

Census Day is important, because whenever you complete your #2020Census, you should count everyone living (or sleeping) in your home most of the time as of April 1—whether you are related to them or not. Respond now at https://t.co/MitVaCYRSz. @AlabamaCounts https://t.co/Cot25b9F7t

Rural hospitals are in dire need of financial relief. I am urging @SecAzar to prioritize immediate funding for rural hospitals with the money we designated HHS on Friday. Secretary Azar, please put HHS to work to save these hospitals. https://t.co/S1GpWBHDbZ
Thank you doctors for all you are doing right now.  You are part of the foot soldiers in this current war we are fighting. #NationalDoctorsDay https://t.co/PgWwXBQzKk

Red Land Cotton in Lawrence County, known for their sheets made with Alabama grown cotton, is now also making masks for healthcare professionals.  Thank you for stepping up to help during this current COVID-19 situation.  https://t.co/ZW1hQhX05b via @YouTube
People are working hard to keep the grocery stores stocked with food, but that food starts with farmers. Thank you for all you're doing! @alfafarmers https://t.co/zj14PpgUGd via @YouTube

Now that @realDonaldTrump has signed the 3rd Coronavirus stimulus bill into law, help will start to flow to millions of Americans.  And @GOPLeader Kevin McCarthy was absolutely instrumental in guiding this bill through Congress.  Thank you!

A big thank you to @RepKayGranger for all the work she and her staff did on the @HouseAppropsGOP committee on guiding this 3rd stimulus bill through the House.  These efforts will soon bring real help to millions of Americans.
I’m back in Washington waiting to vote on the phase 3 stimulus. https://t.co/K6hh79kE39

I have been fighting for the past several years to increase access to broadband internet to rural America. I’m proud to say this 3rd stimulus includes hundreds of millions to make sure people in these areas are never cutoff from telehealth or distance learning again. https://t.co/h3Hrbqcbr9
I'm sorry that Alabama students will not be going back to class, especially for seniors who've had their final year disrupted.  But, these are difficult times and require difficult solutions.
I'm very sorry to hear of this first Coronavirus related death in Alabama.  I know this person's family must be going through a very difficult time.  https://t.co/0PDHOdr8DR

Some good news, the JSU student who was tested for the coronavirus after having some symptoms, has tested negative.

I have been notified that the USDA has granted Alabama a statewide waiver to the National School Lunch Act congregate feeding requirement, it is effective immediately, and will continue through June 30, 2020.

I spoke this afternoon with Len and June Brooks of Cullman.  They are in in quarantine in Texas after being onboard the Grand Princess.  Both are doing fine, are in good spirits and aren't sick.  Hopefully they will get to come home around March 24th. https://t.co/JfbULmgTXk

We know that people who are in nursing homes are probably the most vulnerable to COVID-19.  So, I just want to say to all of the women and men who work at Alabama's nursing homes, how much we appreciate everything you are doing to protect our elderly. Thank you! #nursinghomes
